jobDescription: Essilor of America, Inc. (Essilor), is the leading manufacturer and wholesaler of prescription lenses in the United States.We currently have an R&D; Analytical Scientist career opportunity at our Dallas, TX location.1. Role1.1. The Analytical Scientist conducts problem solving through analysis, analytical procedures development in support of product innovation. He/She may lead technical programs/projects providing understanding for topics pertaining to ophthalmic lens performance, characteristics and mechanisms – including scratch, fracture mechanisms, defect analysis, etc.1.2. The Analytical Scientist is expected to work with little or no technical supervision. He/She is expected to relate materials property as determined by analytical characterization to structure and materials performances and behavior.1.3. The Analytical Scientist is expected to be up to date with the latest analytical technology especially those applicable to polymers and coatings analysis and apply advanced knowledge to the completion of assignments.2. Job responsibilitiesHandle analytical requestsTake the analytical lead on assigned projects with minimum supervision, identify and perform the required analytical tasks in support to product development. Analytical characterization includes (but not limited to) materials analysis, surface/sub-surface characterization, advanced microscopy, and the associated relevant sample preparation. Utilize internal analytical resources, existing external analytical labs for analytical characterization and find new resources necessary (internal, external).Summarize and interpret analytical data; provide root cause analysis (when necessary) and communicate findings to colleagues and management by detailed technical report of findings and oral presentation.Suggest materials and process improvements based on analytical findings to enhance current systems.Set priorities with the R&D; team in terms of analytical work requests and develop workable action plans to ensure that the tasks are completed according to priority status.Build internal partnerships and network by communicating regularly with colleagues within Essilor (in US, Europe and Asia).Build external network of analytical laboratories in complement of internal means, by establishing partnerships with academic and industrial laboratories.Analytical instrumentation and troubleshootingMaintain and troubleshoot analytical instrumentation, within the Analytical Labs as well as some equipment in the Performance Testing and Quality Lab.Lead analytical method development, validation and implementation support. Suggest analytical new instrumentation; evaluate feasibility and justification of proposed purchase.Identify and implement contingency plans to prevent and overcome analytical issues; Perform method and equipment troubleshooting with no supervision.General Duties:Effectively make presentations (written & oral) or written reports to customers, peers, and management as requestedFollow internal program management methodologyMaintain awareness of the state of the art in respective fieldsMaintain up to date technical knowledge about Essilor’s latest products and processesParticipate and represent the department in cross-functional teams and joint projects with other departments (as necessary).Maintain a clean and safe work environment in the laboratory, mentor employees to work safely for them and those around themPotential to lift up to 20 pounds at a timeUse of close vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focusUse safe work practices at all times and report any unsafe conditions immediately3. Qualifications PhD in relevant field with at least 5 years of experience OR Master’s Degree in a relevant technical field (Analytical Chemistry, Polymer Chemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, etc.) with 15 years of practical experience on analytical materials characterization with focus on problem solving. In-depth knowledge of the materials structure-property relationship and applicability of analytical techniques for materials characterization, and proven ability to develop methods and troubleshoot equipment is also required. Knowledge in chemistry, polymers, materials is preferred; knowledge on optics and statistical techniques for data analysis is a plus. Proactive in learning about many technologies. Ability to work and communicate effectively with all members of working groups, skill levels, and expertise in a global environment. Ability to multi-task and prioritize. Understanding and ability to use equipment software and data processing software (GRAMS A/I, OriginLab, KnowItAll, etc.) may be required. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications (Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, etc.). Experience in functional management is a plus. Potential to lift up to 20 pounds at a time. Use of close vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Willingness and ability to travel domestically or internationally, up to 20%.
